headline: Apple Plans to Manufacture Mac Mini in Houston
summary: Apple  will move some production of its Mac Mini desktop computer to the U.S. from Asia, the company told The Wall Street Journal, its latest initiative to reshore parts of its vast supply chain.  The new manufacturing effort will begin later this year at a Foxconn facility in north Houston, said  Sabih Khan,  Apple‚Äôs chief operating officer.

headline: Apple to shift some Mac Mini production to Houston from Asia, WSJ reports
summary: Apple will move some production of its Mac Mini desktop computer to the U.S. from Asia, with a ‚Äånew manufacturing effort set to begin later this year at a ‚ÄåFoxconn facility in north Houston, The Wall Street Journal reported on Monday.  In May,¬†U.S. President Donald Trump¬†had threatened Apple with a 25% tariff on products manufactured overseas, a sharp ‚Äåreversal from earlier policy ‚Å†when his administration had exempted smartphones, computers and other electronics from rounds of tariffs on Chinese imports.  The production for Mac ‚Å†Mini will continue in Asia, its chief operating officer Sabih Khan told WSJ, adding that the facility will meet local demand as the U.S. assembly line ‚Äãramps ‚Äãup.

headline: Apple accelerates U.S. manufacturing, with Mac mini production coming later this year
summary: CUPERTINO, Calif., February 24, 2026--Apple¬Æ today announced a significant expansion of factory operations in Houston, bringing the future production of Mac mini¬Æ to the U.S. for the first time. The company will also expand advanced AI server manufacturing at the factory and provide hands-on training at its new Advanced Manufacturing Center beginning later this year. Altogether, Apple‚Äôs Houston operations will create thousands of jobs.

Altogether, Apple‚Äôs Houston operations will create thousands of jobs.

headline: Apple to shift some Mac Mini production to Houston from Asia
summary: Apple will move some production of its Mac Mini desktop computer to the U.S. ‚Äåfrom Asia, with a new manufacturing effort set ‚Äåto begin later this year at a facility in Houston, the iPhone ‚Äãmaker said on Tuesday.  The plan marks the Apple's most recent U.S. investment, following its commitment announced last August to invest $600 billion in the U.S. over the next four years.  In ‚ÄåMay,¬†U.S. President Donald ‚Å†Trump¬†had threatened Apple with a 25% tariff on products manufactured overseas, a sharp reversal from ‚Å†earlier policy when his administration had exempted smartphones, computers and other electronics from rounds of tariffs on Chinese imports.

In ‚ÄåMay,¬†U.S. President Donald ‚Å†Trump¬†had threatened Apple with a 25% tariff on products manufactured overseas, a sharp reversal from ‚Å†earlier policy when his administration had exempted smartphones, computers and other electronics from rounds of tariffs on Chinese imports.

headline: The Era of "Middlemen" is Over. Max 95% Payout Rate. Next-Generation Video Platform "Chat Market" Launches Simultaneously in the U.S. and Japan, Turning Individual Skills into "True Assets"
summary: TOKYO, February 24, 2026--ONE STEP Co., Ltd. announces the simultaneous launch of "Chat Market" in the U.S. and Japan. Chat Market is a progressive web app (PWA) based video distribution and skill-sharing platform. This service resolves the structural issue of high platform fees (30-50%) in the existing app market by utilizing the latest web technology and a unique payout system, creating a "new economic zone" where creators and professionals can earn their rightful revenue.

content.title: The Era of "Middlemen" is Over. Max 95% Payout Rate. Next-Generation Video Platform "Chat Market" Launches Simultaneously in the U.S. and Japan, Turning Individual Skills into "True Assets"
content.summary: TOKYO, February 24, 2026--ONE STEP Co., Ltd. announces the simultaneous launch of "Chat Market" in the U.S. and Japan. Chat Market is a progressive web app (PWA) based video distribution and skill-sharing platform. This service resolves the structural issue of high platform fees (30-50%) in the existing app market by utilizing the latest web technology and a unique payout system, creating a "new economic zone" where creators and professionals can earn their rightful revenue.

headline: Facebook owner Meta to buy AI chips from AMD in deal worth up to $100 billion
summary: Facebook owner Meta Platforms will buy artificial intelligence chips from Advanced Micro Devices in a deal that will also give it the opportunity to buy up to a 10% stake of the chip company.  News of the AMD deal comes just days after Meta announced a long-term partnership where it will use millions of chips and other equipment from Nvidia for its artificial-intelligence data centers.

content.title: Facebook owner Meta to buy AI chips from AMD in deal worth up to $100 billion
content.summary: Facebook owner Meta Platforms will buy artificial intelligence chips from Advanced Micro Devices in a deal that will also give it the opportunity to buy up to a 10% stake of the chip company.  News of the AMD deal comes just days after Meta announced a long-term partnership where it will use millions of chips and other equipment from Nvidia for its artificial-intelligence data centers.
